intro: Lasiosiphon meisnerianus var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
